P113374.project_name: Benin:  Emergency Food Security Support Project

keywords.cdata: Accountability, accountant, accounting, Accounting Policies, Agricultural Incomes, agricultural inputs, agricultural production, Agricultural Services, Agriculture, audit reports, Auditing, audits, BALANCE of PAYMENTS, Bank Borrowers, Bank policies, Bank supervision, Banks, beneficiaries, beneficiary, Borrower, budgeting, capital formation, CAPITALS, Central Bank, cereal crops, cereal production, cereals, collective actions, commercial bank, Commodity, consumption expenditure, contractual relationship, contractual relationships, cotton, creditors, crop, crop production, CURRENCY, dairy, dairy products, debt, debt service, deposit, Development Bank, Disbursement, Disbursements, diseases, Economics, employment, equipment, Exchange Rate, Expenditure, extension, extension services, farmers, farming, feed, Fertilizer, fertilizer use, fertilizers, financial data, Financial Management, financial management capacity, financial statements, financial support, fish, Fisheries, food access, food crops, food imports, food prices, food production, food products, FOOD SECURITY, Foreign direct investment, fraud, Funds Flow, Government support, grace period, grains, import costs, Incomes, indebtedness, Information Systems, institutional capacities, institutional capacity, institutional development, internal audit, International Accounting Standards, International Standards, Involuntary Resettlement, Lending instrument, Livestock, Loan, maize, maize production, maize yields, malnutrition, mark

project_abstract.cdata: The Emergency Food Security Support Project  for Benin's development objective is to increase domestic production of cereal crops (maize and rice), in order to mitigate the short-term impact of increasing prices on households and to expand food crop farmers' access to agricultural inputs in the medium and long term. The grant will help finance the costs associated with enhancing the production of rice and maize, cereals for which the national food balance is negative. The project will subsidize emergency operations for the provision of fertilizer to 50,000 producers' of rice and maize in 2009. This should result in additional domestic production of about 60,000 tons of cereal (6,000 tons of rice and 54,000 tons of maize) in 2009 (8 percent of the total production in 2007). Moreover, the project will support the design of the innovative market based mechanisms required for the delivery of inputs to food crops producers in the medium and long terms.

P113374.projectinfo: <![CDATA[<Project><LangCode>FR</LangCode><ProjectName>Bénin : Projet d’urgence d’aide à la sécurité alimentaire</ProjectName><ProjectAbstract>L’objectif de développement du Projet d’urgence à la sécurité alimentaire au Bénin est d’accroître la production intérieure de céréales (maïs et riz), pour atténuer l’effet à court terme de la hausse des prix sur les ménages et de développer l’accès des agriculteurs aux intrants agricoles à moyen et long terme. Le don aidera à couvrir les coûts liés à l’augmentation de la production de riz, de maïs et de céréales, denrées pour lesquelles le bilan national est déficitaire. Le projet subventionnera des opérations d’urgence de livraison d’engrais à 50 000 producteurs de riz et de maïs en 2009. Il en résultera un accroissement de la production intérieure d’environ 60 000 tonnes de céréales (6 000 tonnes de riz et 54 000 tonnes de maïs) en 2009 (soit 8 pour cent de la production totale en 2007). De plus, le projet aidera à mettre au point les mécanismes novateurs fondés sur le marché qui sont nécessaires pour pouvoir livrer des intrants aux agriculteurs à moyen et long terme.</ProjectAbstract></Project>]]>
